result.execSummary:
The defendant Johnny Easter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Report to County Jail (<10 Days), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.425(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court has no objection to transferring probation to another county.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Johnny Easter
Current: 14 Obrien Ct, Madison, WI 53714 United States  (Effective: 05-04-2016)
Prior: 1802 Fordem Ave, Madison, WI 53704

10:24 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the amended charge of misdemeanor failure to report to jail.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended charge.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

SWD, and places the defendant on probation for one year.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court orders the cash bond be applied to the court costs.  Court has no objection to transferring probation to another county.

Court adjourned at 10:30 a.m.
State's
(Defendant's)
for Discovery (Defendant's)
Status hearing at 12-14-2015 10:00 am

1:02 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - will be representing the defendant and defendant will waive it.  Defendant concurs.  

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on December 14, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 1:04 p.m.

Defendant appeared in custody and via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.

1:05 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and requests the court read it to him. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $250 cash bond and conditions of:  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on October 27, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.
